title: Sky-GVIO: an enhanced GNSS/INS/Vision navigation with FCN-based sky-segmentation in urban canyon
abstract: arXiv:2404.11070v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: Accurate, continuous, and reliable positioning is a critical component of achieving autonomous driving. However, in complex urban canyon environments, the vulnerability of a stand-alone sensor and non-line-of-sight (NLOS) caused by high buildings, trees, and elevated structures seriously affect positioning results. To address these challenges, a sky-view images segmentation algorithm based on Fully Convolutional Network (FCN) is proposed for GNSS NLOS detection. Building upon this, a novel NLOS detection and mitigation algorithm (named S-NDM) is extended to the tightly coupled Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS), Inertial Measurement Units (IMU), and visual feature system which is called Sky-GVIO, with the aim of achieving continuous and accurate positioning in urban canyon environments. Furthermore, the system harmonizes Single Point Positioning (SPP) with Real-Time Kinematic (RTK) methodologies to bolster its operational ver

Title: Sky-GVIO: an enhanced GNSS/INS/Vision navigation with FCN-based sky-segmentation in urban canyon
Abstract: arXiv:2404.11070v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: Accurate, continuous, and reliable positioning is a critical component of achieving autonomous driving. tldr: 该文章提出了Sky-GVIO系统，它结合了基于全卷积网络(FCN)的屋顶图像分割技术，有效检测GNSS的非视距(NLOS)问题，并引入了一种名为S-NDM的检测和缓解算法，提高了在复杂城市环境中GNSS/INS/视觉导航系统的精度和可靠性。
